Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class ConcurrentBitSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shouldis.bitset.BitSet
      • com.shouldis.bitset.ConcurrentBitSet
  • public class ConcurrentBitSet
extends BitSet
    Implementation of BitSet in which all methods capable of modifying the state of bits are performed as atomic operations. The use of atomic operations allows concurrent modification of this ConcurrentBitSet without any external synchronization at the cost of processing time.

    All methods have behavior as specified by BitSet.

    Author:
    Aaron Shouldis
    See Also:
    BitSet

      Ensures that the bit at the specified index is in the live state.

      Performs a global AND operation on all bits in this BitSet with those in the specified BitSet set.
      private void atomicAnd​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Atomically changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
      private void atomicOr​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Atomically changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an OR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
      private void atomicXOr​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Atomically changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an XOR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
      protected void cleanLastWord()
      Changes the state of any "hanging bits" to the dead state in order to maintain their effect on aggregating functions (BitSet.population(), etc).

      Changes the state of a bit at the specified index to the dead state.

      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range to the dead state.

      • setWord

        protected void setWord​(int wordIndex,
                       long word)

      • atomicAnd

        private void atomicAnd​(int wordIndex,
                       long mask)
        Atomically changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
        words[wordIndex] &= mask;
        Parameters:
        wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to perform the AND operation upon.
        mask - the mask to use in the AND operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.

      • atomicOr

        private void atomicOr​(int wordIndex,
                      long mask)
        Atomically changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an OR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
        words[wordIndex] |= mask;
        Parameters:
        wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to perform the OR operation upon.
        mask - the mask to use in the OR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.

      • atomicXOr

        private void atomicXOr​(int wordIndex,
                       long mask)
        Atomically changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an XOR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
        words[wordIndex] ^= mask;
        Parameters:
        wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to perform the XOR operation upon.
        mask - the mask to use in the XOR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.
